== 2.1. L'alimentation dans le bons sens ==

 * For devLight V2 : Use +5Vdc to +7Vdc input voltage, [http://www.armadeus.com/wiki/index.php?title=Development_boards_power_supply Pour ne pas se tromper...]
 * For all development boards: *+ is in the middle of the connector, - on the side*

= La communication 5V <=> 3,3V =

 * Pour les entrées *sens 5v => 3,3v*
Utilisation du composant [http://www.datasheetcatalog.org/datasheet2/1/03pe5pihyt1rj55dhsuxk1et037y.pdf TPS7333QP : Régulateur 3,3v, 0,5A].

 * Pour les sorties *sens 3,3v => 5v*
Utilisation du composant [http://www.datasheetcatalog.org/datasheet2/e/0lzrsr4j7opqkakja3teqcgjyhwy.pdf SN74AHC244N]: Octal Buffer Driver
 
= Config Elec de la DevLightV2 =
 * Pour les DAC : DAC_REF: corresponds to REF (pin 6) on Max5821. It's the reference voltage (max value that will be achieved by outputs). This input should be connected to a voltage reference between 0 and 3,3V.
   * Connect DAC_REF to 3,3V

 * Pour les ADC : Connect #EOC pin (End Of Conversion) and #CNVST pin (conversion start) to two i.MXL GPIOs. By default the driver is using:
   * PA13 (CSI_HSYNC) for #EOC
   * and PA14 (CSI_PIXCLK) for #CNVST
